name: GLEN-GERY CORPORATION, Petitioner v. ZONING HEARING BOARD OF DOVER TOWNSHIP, York County, Pennsylvania and Dover Township, Respondents
name_abbreviation: Glen-Gery Corp. v. Zoning Hearing Board

parties: GLEN-GERY CORPORATION, Petitioner v. ZONING HEARING BOARD OF DOVER TOWNSHIP, York County, Pennsylvania and Dover Township, Respondents.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 10th day of August, 2005, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED, limited to the following issue:
Whether 42 Pa.C.S. § 5571(c)(5), which requires challenges to the validity of an ordinance alleging a defect in its enactment or adoption be brought within 30 days after the intended effective date of the ordinance, violates due process.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
882 A.2d 461
GLEN-GERY CORPORATION, Petitioner v. ZONING HEARING BOARD OF DOVER TOWNSHIP, York County, Pennsylvania and Dover Township, Respondents.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Aug. 10, 2005.
